Address.description: An address associated with a place.

freeform.description: Free-form address that contains street name, house number and other address info
freeform.title: Freeform

locality.description: City, town, or neighborhood component of the place address
locality.title: Locality

postcode.description: Postal code component of the place address
postcode.title: Postcode

Address.title: Address

Brand.description:
A brand associated with a place.

A location with multiple brands is modeled as multiple separate places, each with its own brand.
Brand.title: Brand

Categories.description:
Categories a place belongs to.

Complete list is available on GitHub: https://github.com/OvertureMaps/schema/blob/main/docs/schema/concepts/by-theme/places/overture_categories.csv

alternate.description:
Alternate categories of the place.

Some places might fit into two categories, e.g., a book store and a coffee shop. In
these cases, the primary category can be augmented with additional categories.
alternate.title: Alternate

primary.description: The primary or main category of the place.
primary.title: Primary

Categories.title: Categories

NameRule.description: Name rule with variant and language specification.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing NameRule applies to.
between.title: Between

perspectives.description: Political perspectives from which a named feature is viewed.

side.description: The side, either left or right, that the containing NameRule applies to.

NameRule.title: NameRule

rules.description: Rules for names that cannot be specified in the simple common names property. These rules can cover other name variants such as official, alternate, and short; and they can optionally include geometric scoping (linear referencing) and side-of-road scoping for complex cases.
rules.title: Rules

OperatingStatus.description:
General indication of whether a place is: in continued operation, in a temporary operating
hiatus, or closed permanently.

Operating status should not be confused with opening hours or operating hours. In particular,
the status `"open"` does not mean the place is open *right now*, it means that in general the
place is continuing to operate normally, as opposed to being in an operating hiatus
(`"temporarily_closed"`) or shuttered (`"permanently_closed"`).
OperatingStatus.title: OperatingStatus

countries.description: Countries holding the given mode of perspective.
countries.title: Countries

mode.description: Whether the perspective holder accepts or disputes this name.

Side.description:
The side, left or right, on which something appears relative to a facing or heading direction
(*e.g.*, the side of a road relative to the road orientation), or relative to the direction of
travel of a person or vehicle.
Side.title: Side

SourcePropertyItem.description:
An object storing the source for a specified property.

The property is a reference to the property element within this Feature, and will be
referenced using JSON Pointer Notation RFC 6901 (
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/rfc6901/).
The source dataset for that referenced property will be specified in the overture list of approved sources from the Overture Data Working Group that contains the relevant metadata for that dataset including license source organization.

between.description: The linearly-referenced sub-segment of the geometry, specified as a range (pair) of percentage displacements from the start of the geometry, that the containing SourcePropertyItem applies to.
between.title: Between

license.description: License name. This should be a valid SPDX license identifier when available. If the license is NULL, contact the data provider for more license information.
license.title: License

record_id.description: Refers to the specific record within the dataset that was used.
record_id.title: Record Id

update_time.description: Timestamp when the feature was last updated
update_time.title: Update Time

SourcePropertyItem.title: SourcePropertyItem

description: A Place is a point representation of a real-world facility, service, or amenity.

bbox.description: An optional bounding box for the feature
bbox.title: Bbox

geometry.description: Position of the place. Places are point geometries.
geometry.title: Geometry

id.description: A feature ID. This may be an ID associated with the Global Entity Reference System (GERS) if—and-only-if the feature represents an entity that is part of GERS.
id.title: Id

^ext_.*$.description:
Additional top-level properties are allowed if prefixed by `ext_`.

This feature is a on a deprecation path and will be removed once the schema is
fully migrated to Pydantic.

addresses.description: The address or addresses of the place
addresses.title: Addresses

basic_category.description:
The basic level category of a place.

This field classifies places into categories at a level that most people find
intuitive. The full list of possible values it may hold can be found at (TODO).

The basic level category, or simply basic category, is based on a cognitive science
model use in taxonomy and ontology development. The idea is to provide the category
name at the level of generality that is preferred by humans in learning and memory
tasks. This category to be roughly in the middle of the general-to-specific category
hierarchy.
basic_category.title: Basic Category

brand.description: The brand associated with the place.

confidence.description:
A score between 0 and 1 indicating how confident we are that the place exists.

A confidence score of 0 indicates that we are certain the place doesn't exist
anymore and will always be paired with an `operating_status` of
`"permanently_closed"`.

A confidence score of 1 indicates that we are certain the place does exist.

If there is no value for confidence, it means we don't have enough information on
which to estimate our confidence level.
confidence.title: Confidence

emails.description: The email addresses of the place.
emails.title: Emails

operating_status.description:
An indication of whether a place is: in continued operation, in a temporary
operating hiatus, or closed permanently.

This is not an indication of opening hours or that the place is open/closed at the
current time-of-day or day-of-week.

When `operating_status` is `"permanently_closed"`, the `confidence` field will be
set to 0.

phones.description: The phone numbers of the place.

items.description: International phone number (+ followed by country code and number)

phones.title: Phones

socials.description: The social media URLs of the place.
socials.title: Socials

sources.description: The array of source information for the properties of a given feature, with each entry being a source object which lists the property in JSON Pointer notation and the dataset approved sources from the Overture Data Working Group that contains the relevant metadata for that dataset including license source organization.
sources.title: Sources

title: place
